chargeHist.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mandeep S Gill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
IF REVOKED 1 day sentence credit granted
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes: Cash bail previously posted applied, fine paid in full.

Cash bail previously posted applied, costs paid in full. Balance to be refunded to the poster.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for the Town of Brookfield Police Department

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment. 

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by agent

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel

timeConds.notes: CONDITION TIME - Huber with release for work and school commences forthwith. Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Mandeep S Gill in court.  Attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot in court for Mandeep S Gill.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes a plea questionnaire was filed and recites the offer.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Bobot.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1: 
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3 Years Imprisonment (1 Day Credit IF imposed)
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	1 Year of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program IF revoked.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program IF revoked.

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Term of Probation: 3 Years (Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County)

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision (IF revoked):
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription
-       Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel. 	

Condition Time: 300 Days Huber with release for work and School (Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County) - To commence forthwith.

FINE:  $1,632.00 (includes IID surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $36.05 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Brookfield Police Department.

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Court to apply the $6,500.00 Cash Bail on deposit; any remaining bail to be refunded to the Poster.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:00 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Mandeep S Gill in court with attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes there is a recent WCS non-compliance report.  Atty. Bobot was not aware of the most recent report.  Court provides Atty. Bobot with a copy of the report and admonishes the defendant with respect to the non-compliance.  Atty. Bobot provides an update, and notes the blood test results have come in but they are waiting on the new charge to be filed.  Atty. Will confirms and advises the State will file the amended information adding the additional charge with respect to the blood test result.  Atty. Bobot requests a plea and sentencing date in about 60 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 8/3/2022 received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

THE DEFENDANT POSTED $1,500.00 CASH BAIL AND NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $5,000.00.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency until further order of the court.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

The Court calls the matter for Bail Bond Hearing.
The Court notes that WCS did file a non-compliance letter filed on 6/27/2022.
The Court notes that WCS did file a compliance letter on 07/07/2022.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
For reason set out on the record, the Court increases the cash bail from $1,500.00 to $6,500.00 and SCRAM shall be kept on until further order of the court.
